verses.kjv: Now Jehoram the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned twelve years.
verses.web: Now Jehoram the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned twelve years.
verses.ct: Jehoram son of Ahab became king of Israel in Samaria during the 18th year of King Jehoshaphat of Judah's reign. He ruled for 12 years.

verses.kjv: And he wrought evil in the sight of the LORD; but not like his father, and like his mother: for he put away the image of Baal that his father had made.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, but not like his father, and like his mother, for he put away the pillar of Baal that his father had made.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that he was evil, but he wasn't as bad as his father and mother had been. He did remove the sacred pillar of Baal that his father had set up.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless he cleaved unto the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, which made Israel to sin; he departed not therefrom.
verses.web: Nevertheless he held to the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, with which he made Israel to sin. He didn’t depart from them.
verses.ct: Even so, he held on to the sins that Jeroboam son of Nebat had introduced to Israel. He never turned away from them.

verses.kjv: And Mesha king of Moab was a sheepmaster, and rendered unto the king of Israel an hundred thousand lambs, and an hundred thousand rams, with the wool.
verses.web: Now Mesha king of Moab was a sheep breeder; and he supplied the king of Israel with the wool of one hundred thousand lambs, and of one hundred thousand rams.
verses.ct: King Mesha of Moab was a sheep breeder, and he paid tribute to the king of Israel — 100,000 lambs and the wool of 100,000 rams.

verses.kjv: But it came to pass, when Ahab was dead, that the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.
verses.web: But when Ahab was dead, the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.
verses.ct: But after Ahab died, the king of Moab rebelled against Israel.

verses.kjv: And king Jehoram went out of Samaria the same time, and numbered all Israel.
verses.web: King Jehoram went out of Samaria at that time, and mustered all Israel.
verses.ct: So King Jehoram marched out of Samaria and assembled the entire Israelite army.

verses.kjv: And he went and sent to Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, saying, The king of Moab hath rebelled against me: wilt thou go with me against Moab to battle? And he said, I will go up: I am as thou art, my people as thy people, and my horses as thy horses.
verses.web: He went and sent to Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, saying, “The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will you go with me against Moab to battle?” He said, “I will go up. I am as you are, my people as your people, my horses as your horses.”
verses.ct: He also sent a message to King Jehoshaphat of Judah: "The king of Moab has rebelled against me. Will you join me in fighting him?" Jehoshaphat replied, "I'm with you. My troops are your troops, and my horses are your horses."

verses.kjv: And he said, Which way shall we go up? And he answered, The way through the wilderness of Edom.
verses.web: He said, “Which way shall we go up?” He answered, “The way of the wilderness of Edom.”
verses.ct: Jehoram asked, "Which route should we take?" Jehoshaphat answered, "Through the wilderness of Edom."

verses.kjv: So the king of Israel went, and the king of Judah, and the king of Edom: and they fetched a compass of seven days’ journey: and there was no water for the host, and for the cattle that followed them.
verses.web: So the king of Israel went with the king of Judah and the king of Edom, and they marched for seven days along a circuitous route. There was no water for the army or for the animals that followed them.
verses.ct: So the king of Israel set out with the king of Judah and the king of Edom. They marched along a roundabout route for 7 days, and then the water ran out — there was nothing left for the army or the animals traveling with them.

verses.kjv: And the king of Israel said, Alas! that the LORD hath called these three kings together, to deliver them into the hand of Moab!
verses.web: The king of Israel said, “Alas! For LORD has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.”
verses.ct: The king of Israel cried out, "This is a disaster! The LORD has brought us 3 kings together just to hand us over to Moab!"

verses.kjv: But Jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the LORD, that we may enquire of the LORD by him? And one of the king of Israel’s servants answered and said, Here is Elisha the son of Shaphat, which poured water on the hands of Elijah.
verses.web: But Jehoshaphat said, “Isn’t there a prophet of LORD here, that we may inquire of LORD by him?” One of the king of Israel’s servants answered, “Elisha the son of Shaphat, who poured water on the hands of Elijah, is here.”
verses.ct: But Jehoshaphat asked, "Isn't there a prophet of the LORD here we can consult?" One of the king of Israel's officers spoke up: "Elisha son of Shaphat is here — the one who served as Elijah's personal attendant."

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat said, The word of the LORD is with him. So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him.
verses.web: Jehoshaphat said, “LORD’s word is with him.” So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him.
verses.ct: Jehoshaphat said, "The word of the LORD is with him." So the king of Israel, Jehoshaphat, and the king of Edom all went down to see Elisha.

verses.kjv: And Elisha said unto the king of Israel, What have I to do with thee? get thee to the prophets of thy father, and to the prophets of thy mother. And the king of Israel said unto him, Nay: for the LORD hath called these three kings together, to deliver them into the hand of Moab.
verses.web: Elisha said to the king of Israel, “What have I to do with you? Go to the prophets of your father, and to the prophets of your mother.” The king of Israel said to him, “No, for LORD has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.”
verses.ct: Elisha said to the king of Israel, "Why are you coming to me? Go ask your father's prophets or your mother's prophets." But the king of Israel pleaded, "No — the LORD is the one who brought us 3 kings together to hand us over to Moab!"

verses.kjv: And Elisha said, As the LORD of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, surely, were it not that I regard the presence of Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, I would not look toward thee, nor see thee.
verses.web: Elisha said, “As LORD of Armies lives, before whom I stand, surely, were it not that I respect the presence of Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, I would not look toward you, nor see you.
verses.ct: Elisha replied, "As surely as the LORD of Armies lives — the one I serve — if it weren't for my respect for King Jehoshaphat of Judah, I wouldn't even look in your direction."

verses.kjv: But now bring me a minstrel. And it came to pass, when the minstrel played, that the hand of the LORD came upon him.
verses.web: But now bring me a musician.” When the musician played, LORD’s hand came on him.
verses.ct: "But bring me a musician." While the musician played, the hand of the LORD came upon Elisha.

verses.kjv: And he said, Thus saith the LORD, Make this valley full of ditches.
verses.web: He said, “LORD says, ‘Make this valley full of trenches.’
verses.ct: He said, "This is what the LORD says: Dig this valley full of trenches.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, Ye shall not see wind, neither shall ye see rain; yet that valley shall be filled with water, that ye may drink, both ye, and your cattle, and your beasts.
verses.web: For LORD says, ‘You will not see wind, neither will you see rain, yet that valley will be filled with water, and you will drink, both you and your livestock and your other animals.
verses.ct: The LORD says: You won't see any wind, and you won't see any rain, but this valley will fill with water. You, your livestock, and all your animals will have plenty to drink.

verses.kjv: And this is but a light thing in the sight of the LORD: he will deliver the Moabites also into your hand.
verses.web: This is an easy thing in LORD’s sight. He will also deliver the Moabites into your hand.
verses.ct: And that's just a small thing for the LORD. He will also hand the Moabites over to you.

verses.kjv: And ye shall smite every fenced city, and every choice city, and shall fell every good tree, and stop all wells of water, and mar every good piece of land with stones.
verses.web: You shall strike every fortified city, and every choice city, and shall fell every good tree, and stop all springs of water, and mar every good piece of land with stones.’ ”
verses.ct: You will tear down every fortified city and every important town. You will cut down every productive tree, block every spring of water, and ruin every good field by covering it with stones."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the morning, when the meat offering was offered, that, behold, there came water by the way of Edom, and the country was filled with water.
verses.web: In the morning, about the time of offering the sacrifice, behold, water came by the way of Edom, and the country was filled with water.
verses.ct: The next morning, right around the time of the morning sacrifice, water came flowing in from the direction of Edom, and the whole area was flooded with it.

verses.kjv: And when all the Moabites heard that the kings were come up to fight against them, they gathered all that were able to put on armour, and upward, and stood in the border.
verses.web: Now when all the Moabites heard that the kings had come up to fight against them, they gathered themselves together, all who were able to put on armor, young and old, and stood on the border.
verses.ct: When the Moabites heard that the kings had come to fight them, they called up every man old enough to carry weapons and stationed them along the border.

verses.kjv: And they rose up early in the morning, and the sun shone upon the water, and the Moabites saw the water on the other side as red as blood:
verses.web: They rose up early in the morning, and the sun shone on the water, and the Moabites saw the water opposite them as red as blood.
verses.ct: They got up early that morning, and when the sun rose and hit the water, the Moabites looked across and saw it glowing red as blood.

verses.kjv: And they said, This is blood: the kings are surely slain, and they have smitten one another: now therefore, Moab, to the spoil.
verses.web: They said, “This is blood. The kings are surely destroyed, and they have struck each other. Now therefore, Moab, to the plunder!”
verses.ct: They shouted, "That's blood! The kings must have turned on each other and slaughtered one another! Come on, Moab — let's grab the plunder!"

verses.kjv: And when they came to the camp of Israel, the Israelites rose up and smote the Moabites, so that they fled before them: but they went forward smiting the Moabites, even in their country.
verses.web: When they came to the camp of Israel, the Israelites rose up and struck the Moabites, so that they fled before them; and they went forward into the land attacking the Moabites.
verses.ct: But when they reached the Israelite camp, the Israelites charged out and attacked them. The Moabites broke and ran, and the Israelites chased them deep into their own territory, cutting them down as they went.

verses.kjv: And they beat down the cities, and on every good piece of land cast every man his stone, and filled it; and they stopped all the wells of water, and felled all the good trees: only in Kirharaseth left they the stones thereof; howbeit the slingers went about it, and smote it.
verses.web: They beat down the cities; and on every good piece of land each man cast his stone, and filled it. They also stopped all the springs of water, and cut down all the good trees, until in Kir Hareseth all they left was its stones; however the men armed with slings went around it, and attacked it.
verses.ct: They demolished the cities, and every soldier threw stones onto every good piece of farmland until it was covered. They blocked every spring and chopped down every productive tree. Finally, only Kirharaseth was left standing, and even that city was surrounded by slingers who battered it.

verses.kjv: And when the king of Moab saw that the battle was too sore for him, he took with him seven hundred men that drew swords, to break through even unto the king of Edom: but they could not.
verses.web: When the king of Moab saw that the battle was too severe for him, he took with him seven hundred men who drew a sword, to break through to the king of Edom; but they could not.
verses.ct: When the king of Moab realized the battle was lost, he gathered 700 swordsmen and tried to break through the lines toward the king of Edom, but they couldn't get through.

verses.kjv: Then he took his eldest son that should have reigned in his stead, and offered him for a burnt offering upon the wall. And there was great indignation against Israel: and they departed from him, and returned to their own land.
verses.web: Then he took his oldest son who would have reigned in his place, and offered him for a burnt offering on the wall. There was great wrath against Israel; and they departed from him, and returned to their own land.
verses.ct: In desperation, he took his oldest son — the heir to his throne — and sacrificed him as a burnt offering on the city wall. A fierce anger erupted against Israel, so the Israelites withdrew and returned to their own land.
